text: Thought it would be better. Very basic and over-priced. Suggest not wasting time.

You know a good deli when half the place is filled by Jewish seniors having lunch there on a Tuesday. Had sandwiches from here twice for lunch and both times it has been great. There bread is fresh and delicious and paired with a good quality meat it makes for a hearty lunch. Add on a pickle and some nice cold potato salad and I'm set. The service is friendly and fast. Only knock on it is the price - $10 is a bit much for a sandwich and chips (no drink) but I'll keep coming back.

What a wonderful experience with owner Mat and Alison who catered Break the Fast
For our Sun City Anthem  Havurah.we had
180 attendees and I had such a phenomenal response from the Jewish community here! Huge variety of bagels and breads, tuna salad, egg salad,whitefish salad, noodle kugel, crumb cake and a variety of cookies! 
Plus 2 kinds of cream cheese and kosher 
Pickles !  He delivered from Summerlin!!!
WOW!!
This bakery gets my vote from now on!
Great spot! Fresh food! Friendly clean service! Luv the deli meats.. Better than bagel cafe.

How do they do it?  Everything is perfect. The rye bread is the best in the city, maybe even anywhere. And you can buy half a loaf so that you always have fresh bread.  Not to mention that the bread stays fresh and wonderful, not like other bakery bread which dries out in a day.  No one makes bagels like this from California to Toronto.  The crumb cake of my dreams.  Everything is so tempting and delicious. It is hard to live so near to them without wanting to stop in all the time.  These people take pride in their product and rightfully so. We are fortunate to have them in our community.

Dont need to many words to describe this place .  The place is very nice , the bagels were so fresh and so much flavors to choose from. Make sure you get there early to get your favorite ones. We even took half a dozen to go .
Best bagel place in Vegas, love the crazy variety of bagels they have. Very friendly and nice staff. Love the music choice in the background too. Nice place to grab a breakfast

Just tried this for the first time.  Great little bagel shop with a great assortment of bagels, pastries and all kinds of goodies.  Very clean place and friendly staff.  They were very patient as we became overwhelmed with the choices.  They also have sandwiches and platters.  Oh and how I can forget the cookies!  Great to support independent businesses!

You will not find a better NY style bagel than you will at Lifes A Bagel but it doesnt end there. The sandwiches and fresh baked breads are out of this world. My favorite, I mean one of my favorites is The Twist, but any sandwich on the menu won't disappoint. Its great having Matt Sterling (from the original Sterling Bros Bagels) back with Alison by his side. They have been greatly missed by the residents of Summerlin and Sun City.

Poor service. I waited 10 minutes at the counter as the manager working at the counter walked off and had a conversation with a dine in customer. The other girl working at the counter walked past me a few times without saying a word. 

Needless to say I walked out and will not be returning here. I will be sure to pass this review on as well.

This is a great authentic New York Bagelry. They even have bialys. Do you know how hard it is to find a bialy in this state? Practically impossible nobody even knows what they are. Even New York Deli doesn't know nor make them.
Next time I'll get some coffee cake or rugelach.
You guys rock. Best bagel place in Vegas for many years.   They also have fresh baked challah bread everyday .   I highly recommend going here and trying it.  Sandwiches are also very good for lunch.
Always great and they deliver definitely second to the bagel cafe though. Nice variety and the device is always nice as well. Whenever I get food from them I always have a pleasant experience
The best bagels! The best challah! and best of all really close to my house!!! DEFINITELY recommend!  My only criticism is that they need more help.....

Fresh breads daily.  I found this place today and they had the best Egg Salad Sandwich, very fresh and delicious.  Cannoli's made to order and they have some tiny finger desserts.  I will definitely be going back.

Ordered food from ubereats. Ordered bagles, veggie cream cheese, lox plate and matzo ball soup. Bagels were delicious; light, fluffy and chewy. Hubby says the lox were nice and smokey. Soup was good but arrived a little cold. All in all...definitely repeat customers.
My very favorite place for bagels, lox, challah & the best mandel bread ever!!

Its a bit on the pricey side if you buy anything other than a bagel. The bagels are pretty good though! Plus the extra dollar and change for cream cheese is a little outrageous. Ive never seen a place charge more than maybe 50 cents for some cream cheese. The staff were kind and the atmosphere is nice but over all a bit too pricey.

This is our new bagel place! We stumbled upon this place through yelp and I am so glad we did.  My boyfriend and I tried the everything bagel with veggie creamcheese and the veggie delight sandwich. Everything was fresh and delicious! The girl behind the counter was very attentive and fast and the place itself is very organized and clean!!!
This is my 1st time being here and it was absolutely the best real New York bagels real New York food real New York people

BEST BAGEL STORE IN VEGAS!  First, they have bialys that are as good or better than the ones I grew up eating in NY! Their chopped liver is addicting! I've been enjoying whitefish & baked salmon salads for over 50 years & I've eaten it from the "best known & highest rated" smoked fish sellers and Life's A Bagel's is as good as any I've ever enjoyed! They have fresh homemade cream cheeses, my fav is their lite veggie. I believe they are very fairly priced for the quality of food they sell.
I couldn't complete this review without urging everyone to try their world-class crumb cake (I get 2 large cakes to take home). Their owners are very nice people who care about their customers and are exceptionally accommodating!  They also have an amazing selection of fresh baked breads.  
We used to get our appetizing & bagels from another bagel shop, but since we tried Life's A Bagel they have become the only bagel (bialy) shop we go to!

Been in the desert for 20 years and never found bagels like I was used to growing up in New Jersey. My husband picked them up so I have no photos but will definitely come back. Bagels were dense and delicious, as was the cream cheese. Bagel bags were included for storage.
They don't take credit card under $10 and I never have cash! Who does anymore? Their bagels Are quite good although several items in the store are a. It pricier than I expected.
Delicious bagel, bialys, and challah. Fresh cream cheese, Very nice people. All items made there with great recipes. Reasonable price and good fast friendly service..

Bagels & breads baked fresh each day! 

Well I'm the type of girl that gets excited when you can smell fresh bread from the parking lot!

They make pumpernickel!!! Along with many other great breads and of course a nice variety of bagels. My go to is an everything toasted with cream cheese and it's excellent here. There are other goodies as well such as cookies, deli meats, soups & salads. 

The shop is small with a few tables inside and it's a great option for a quick breakfast or lunch.

NY Crumb Cake actually baked on the premises. Since leaving the east coast 40 years ago, this is the first time I have found a bakery / deli out west actually making NY crumb cake.  And it is excellent.  So while they can order the crumbcake that Gelsons got via Boarshead in New York, try theirs first.  Same price, different shape tin, but a little deeper.  I used to travel 48 miles roundtrip to get crumbcake at Gelson's.  Now I only have to go 21 miles to Life's a Bagel.  For those of you who don't make frequent trips to indulge a favorite food craving, they can sell you sheets of crumb cake which you can then cut up and freeze.  A couple of doors down from the Smith's at North Rampart, on the north side of W. Lake Mead.

The bagels are great and also the cream cheese is made from scratch! The veggie cream cheese has carrots, celery, onions, etc. Very delicious! Haven't tried there cookies or loafs but they look amazing!

Bagel selection is pretty decent, and the bagels themselves are huge and tasty- good chew, strong flavors. You can even get them 14/$10, which is a pretty good deal. Just don't get them as a sandwich- it'll run you over $10! They have a Nova bagel special that is just under $9 but for the more generic veggie, turkey, etc sandwiches, it's pricey but comes with a side of chips, potato salad, or macaroni salad*.

The bialy, garlic, and everything bagel flavors are solid- they even offer a french toast bagel I haven't yet been brave enough to try. No whole wheat bagels or fat free cream cheeses available. They have a scallion cream cheese, herring and white fish in the refrigerator case, and matzo ball soup as a special. Don't leave without a black and white!

*NOTE: The pasta salad is made with Miracle Whip, consider yourself warned.

Great bagels, super-creamy cream cheese, friendly staff, and very affordable.
Truly a 5-star place.

I stopped in for lunch today after a friend's recommendation. The place was busy for such a small place. I looked over the menu and decided on The San Francisco sandwich on sourdough with macaroni salad. I had a really hard time deciding on the sourdough. My first instinct was to get it on an everything bagel, but the pumpernickel looked fabulous, as well as the wheat, and the marble rye. I then saw the high crown on the sourdough loaf and the rest was history. I also ordered an everything bagel with plain cream cheese while I looked over the sweets. I had remembered hearing good things about the coffee cake and the black and whites. Decisions decisions. I chose a whole coffee cake, why not, it was $2.50 a slice or $5.00 for the cake. 
I took my order to go and headed home. 
I opened my order and inhaled it. There was so much turkey on the sandwich and the sourdough was soft and pillowy. The Mac salad was very creamy and the noodles perfect. The bagel was good with a chewy texture, the only downside was it could have used some salt in the everything mix. I added a pinch and was happy. The cream cheese was silky creamy and there was lots of it. 
Later in the day I unwrapped the coffee cake, while I prepared my afternoon tea. One bite and HOLY MOLY was it good! Tender crumb, moist, so much flavor. Mmmm. They also serve Chieti coffee, which is locally roasted here in Vegas for $1.85 for a large cup.
While the sandwiches are a little on the higher price side they are delicious and that coffee cake is absolutely scrumptious. I will definitely be back.

I used Uber Eats. Your food is amazing! Your bagels are huge and soft! I was very pleased with your selection. I told my co-workers about it  and they ordered it today. They were pleased! We all have to say that this place is way better then your competitor.. EB.

I frequent "Life's A Bagel" at least 3 times a week, The Deli sandwiches are the best I have had since living in Sun City Summerlin! The soups are another reason that I visit, they are the closest I have tasted to my wife's home made soups. The lentil soup with corned beef, potatoes & other vegetables-is 2nd to none. As far as I'm concerned, you will get the best bang for the money spent due to the quality & taste of the food offered at "Life's A Bagel".

Literally sitting in the store right now. Had to rate it because that bagel was exactly what it was supposed to be. I got an egg bagel (which nowhere ever has) with scallion cream cheese, lox, tomatoes, and capers - the nova sandwich, no onions. I've had good New York bagels, and this was not a disappointment. And for $10??? It's cheaper and just as good or even better as the Bagel Cafe down the street - and I'm a big Bagel Cafe fan. The staff was super friendly, the place is clean, and I'm having to use every ounce of willpower in my body to not buy an entire cake. I would add a picture of my bagel, but the plate is already 100% clean. Maybe next time.

Went here with my grandparents, it's their favorite deli to go to. I had a delicious corned beef sandwich!  The cinnamon cream cheese coffee cake is a must! Friendly service and quiet atmosphere. Close parking can be difficult, but it's worth it.

This place is a like a little corner of NYC here in Vegas - except for the bagels.  They taste good, but they do not have the texture of a true NYC bagel.

The fresh breads are excellent - marble rye especially.  The black-and-white cookies are *amazing* (ask when they were made - they are amazing on the same day, very good on the next day and disappointing after that - IMO they should mark them "day-old" or something).   The other NYC-bakery style desserts are excellent too.

The deli has great smoked fish, meats and salads, and the sandwiches are delicious and very generously sized.  

The restaurant is spotless and the staff is friendly and efficient.
Nice little place in sun city. I've had their tuna and chicken salad on a bagel. Both have been good and keeps me coming back for more. They have good dessert as well.

Thanks a LOX, Life's A Bagel!

This is a super cute lil ol' husband and wife owned, neighborhood bagel house. They have, by far, the best nova lox bagel in town! We always order the Lox Platter $13.99 - Nova Lox, perfectly ripe tomato, red onions, capers, a dill pickle spear and your choice of bagel and cream cheese. I typically get the sesame or everything bagel and scallion cream cheese for this. It's superb and such a great value for all of the high quality lox and fresh goodies loaded up on the plate. Make sure to request your bagel toasted, it is sooo good!

If you don't feel like getting that much food, they also offer a lox sandwich as well, about $10 or less. It's also generously stuffed and usually I can only finish half. Their bagel sandwiches and platters are piled high with a lot of fresh ingredients. The bagels are baked fresh daily with a unique variety. We love the cheddar bagels, sesame, onion, garlic, everything, cinnamon raisin, and they also offer French toast bagels! Their bagels are huge with a desirable soft and chewy consistency, which also crisps up nicely in the toaster. The different cream cheese options are hand-mixed in house. I love the scallion or the cheddar jalapeño cream cheese.

As with a typical New York style deli, their deli case offers a nice selection of bakery sweets, NY Silverlake Cookies, fresh baked bread, deli meats, cheese, prepared deli salads.

This is a locals hang out and it gets very busy, especially on the weekend mornings. It's also nestled amidst the Sun City Summerlin senior living community, so you'll definitely catch a lot of regulars.

You can really taste all of the quality and love made here!

This is the second bagel shop I have hit up inside a week. I think after being in the middle of nowhere for so long I am going a little overboard trying new places, lol!

Anyhow, I picked up some bagels, a coffee cake, and some pastrami here. It's a nice little shop on a strip mall with plenty of parking. I was helped right away and given the suggestion to try the coffee cake. I had a Poppy seed, French toast, and garlic bagel. I had them over the course of a few days for lunch, making egg sandwiches with them. The bagels were good. Nothing exceptional about them, but they were cheap, big, and had the right texture. The pastrami was good too, but again just the typical deli pastrami.

The coffee cake was really good though, and quite large. That lasted me a couple days - which normally doesn't happen with dessert, lol.

Eat here or be catered from here; this is the closest to a New York bagel available in Vegas. Huge, perfectly crusty bagels of all sorts including bialys, classic everything and something called "french toast" bagel. We catered an affair from Life's a Bagel and the guests specifically commented how fresh and good everything was. Plenty of food for the price and extras thrown in on the house. When I come to that side of town, I get the vegetarian sandwich, very satisfying.

The Sterling's are back! Still doing the best bagel in Las Vegas and their sandwiches are overstuffed with your choice of meats, cheeses, prepared and tasty spreads, and herring. I believe the younger bother reopened the place and is making good the claim that you can have your bagel in Vegas and eat it too. Thank you for coming back to the neighborhood.  You were sorely missed.

Great bagels! I got breakfast sandwiches on cheddar bagels with bacon egg and cheese-they tasted really good. Fresh made and  toasted perfectly. The entire store was clean and inviting. We will definitely be back!

This is my favorite deli for breakfast or a quick bite. Everything is always fresh and tastes amazing. All of the staff is also very friendly and makes every visit pleasant. Definitely a great small business to support!

Ordered from UberEats for delivery.   Ordered half a dozen bagels, strawberry cream cheese, 1/2 pound of ham and a black and white cookie.  Delivery was super fast, bagels were fresh, chewy and delicious.  Cream cheese was a little weird but ok.  Ham was good.  Now the cookie, oh geesh, that thing was bigger than my head!!

We used to go to Bagel Cafe but they have gone downhill.  We now go to Life a Bagel for bagel, and spreads.  The bagels are delicious, when you buy a half a dozen they charge you for five and they will slice them for no charge.  You can also substitute the challah rolls for bagels.  The chopped liver is as good as I make and the baked salmon salad is delicious.  We have had their sandwiches from time to time and they are stuffed with whatever we have chosen and delicious.  They are so big they can be shared.  The customer service is the best.

LOVE this place! We come here on Sundays to get fresh bagels. My husband gets egg sandwiches and the eggs are made fresh - not the weird egg patties a lot of places use. I love their egg bagels and fresh cream cheese. 

The bagels are always fresh, always well-stocked, and the people who work here are friendly. We love bagel cafe and didn't think anything would compare, but this place is just as good if not BETTER!

Visited this place for the first time yesterday. Outshines EVERY bagel place I ever tried in Las Vegas or LA. Light, airy, not chewy or doughy . . .and super fresh. Generous portions and nice variety.
But . . . more than just a bagel place . . .a Jewish deli with terrific sandwiches (tried pastrami and egg salad), excellent soups (had split pea and corned beef), and incredible desserts (had homemade brownies but saw some incredible multilayered cakes (will have try next time). Clean cafe with efficient, courteous servers. Family owned and operated  . . . and the pride shows! Loved it . . .can't wait to go back!

Solid New York/ Jewish deli. Small place that's more of your grab and go bagel shop. They have about 10 tables total and offer plenty of sandwich or bagel options from pastrami to lox. They also have some elective looking pastries and desserts like the classic black and white and rugelach. Plenty of good looking sides as well with potato salad and big kosher pickles. I just went for a quick lox bagel to go but it was loaded up and came out quickly. No complaints. A great start to a morning or a lunch destination for sure. Prices are on the higher side (my bagel was $9+ after tax) but the quality is good and people are nice.

OMG I think this is my new favorite Bagel Spot the bagels were so fresh and good the cream cheese was delicious I also tried their homemade hummus yummy they bake fresh bread daily I can't wait to go back and try that and they also have sandwiches

Today is the 3rd time I have visited this bakery slash deli in 2 weeks. I'm addicted. The French toast bagel with strawberry cream cheese is awesome! Place is always packed and it looks like the owner is working as hard as his staff. My only drawback is the wait is longer than expected. Maybe increase staff by 2 would help. I posted pictures of the Pastrami Sammy and a bialy bagel with scallion cream cheese. A must for all bagel lovers !

This place runs in slow motion! I do not know if it is the flock of Sun City aged, or the fact that slow is the only speed?
Be prepared for a wait, even if you are the only customer.
Their product is OK...somewhat akin to your typical frozen bagel shop.
If you want legitimate bagels go to The Bagel Cafe. By far superior product, service that is efficient and they are always super polite!
Some things that Life's a Bagel could do well to study.

I've ordered delivery from this place many times and have never been dissatisfied. I usually order the half dozen cheddar bagels and cream cheese and this time ordered the iced coffee. Wonderful!! One day I hope to visit this place and thank everyone for the wonderful service! Being in a wheelchair I usually stay at home during the weekends and I can depend on excellent delivery service from this bagel joint .. I will be a long time customer!! Thank you guys and gals!! Oh btw I use Grubhub to order delivery service. Surprised Eat24 doesn't have this eatery.. Eat24 is a service of Yelp

Happened to notice the place (not easy, hardly any signage, squeezed next to Smith's Grocery), checked feedback here on Yelp, and gave it a try.

Nice place inside, plenty of seating, those at the register, helpful and nice.  Tried the bagels and a salami sandwich (pik attached). Both were great tasting and reasonably priced.  Bread was fresh as was the meat.

Solid 5 stars.  Will add it to my list of to go places...

This wonderful deli sandwich was Veggie Sandwich on rye with an addition of chopped liver which you see on the bottom.  It tasted like New York deli and I loved every bit of it. The chopped liver was perfect like my mamma used to make. My friend also loved her chopped liver sandwich on rye.
The people were so nice and very accommodating.
Perfect costumer service and the food is amazing, the bagels are so good and the homemade products make everything so good. Recommended

This place is the closest thing you will find to a NY Kosher Deli. The baked goods are always fresh & never disappoint. I especially like the crumb cake and the marble rye.
My wishlist includes Kaiser rolls!
Great bagel! Next time going to try the bialy. They also have NY style crumb cake with the huge crumbs.  It was hard to decide what to eat, everything looks so good!

It's not easy finding a Jewish deli where we live, a quality one at that. 
I love their bagels, especially with some lox on top!  When still lived around the corner I would get cold cuts from their as well.

Such a nice atmosphere. 
I walk in skeptical because I've not found a bagel that suits me well. 
But this bagel was so good. 
Then gave me a free challah on the house! Will be back.

This storefront has been the site for many different bagel places over the past 20 years. We've tried Life's a Bagel 3x.  I've had the lox & bagel and the tuna salad.  Both were delicious and had high quality ingredients.  My hubby loves the turkey & swiss.  The chicken soup is amazing. Best in town.

My only complaint is that if you try to call in an order the phone is perpetually busy.  Are they doing that on purpose or is the wrong phone number listed on the website and on Yelp?  At least have someone answer the phone or have a recoding that says you don't take phone in orders on Sundays.  Very frustrating...
We are so happy that this store opened in our neighborhood. The bread, the bagels, the cakes, the appetizing section... I can't say enough about the quality of the food in the store.

My favorite bagels in town. Matt makes the bagels fresh every morning and the prices are great. Fresh cream cheese too. Good sandwich selection and they serve breakfast sandwiches all day too which are my favorite. Very accommodating. I love it there.

It was very good the bagels are very yummy the people are super friendly the only thing I didn't like was I was the the salmon spread was a little more salmon in it but besides that I thought it was very good and yummy place

Have driven by here many times, finally decided to stop in yesterday and oh man! I am so mad at myself for not coming sooner! Great prices, good selection on bagels and spreads. Got myself a few onion and garlic bagels which they kindly offered to slice for me (uh yes please!!). Popped those babies in the fridge last night, toasted one up this morning and, oh my word, super delicious! I've been in the Northwest part of the Valley for 10 years, and finally, I have found my new favorite shop for bagels. Will definitely keep coming back when I move to the Southwest part of the Valley later this year.

Reminds me of a bagel shop in New York!!!
Staff is always pleasant...  Freshest bagels in town.  Challah and marble rye are amazing. 
Every time I come here, I feel like I'm out of Vegas for a few minutes. 
The ham, cheese, and egg breakfast bagel sandwich is fantastic. It's nice to go somewhere and have fresh eggs. 
Located off Rampatt and Lke Mead in the Smith's shopping center, this is a hidden spot. Check it out and share the goodness.

I noticed this place next to the Omelette House in Summerlin, so I decided to stop in and try their bagels.

It is a decent size store with a small seating area. There are only two small deli cases. They have a limited menu. They did not have any whole grain bagels. The only wheat option they had was a honey wheat bagel. They also do not have any fat-free cream cheese.

We ordered the French Toast and Everything Bagels toasted with lite cream cheese. They were good bagels. I have had better. Honesty, I like Einstein Bagels and Dunkin Donuts bagels more than this place. Plus, they have a better selection for what I want.

I recommend that you stop in and try their bagels, as long as your not coming for whole grain bagels.
It took us a while to find a good bagel place after moving to Vegas from LA and life's a bagel is that place. My favorite is the sausage, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich, yum!!
Probably the best bagels and lox we've ever tried.  Also the best price for the quality.  Will definitely be a return customer
Welcome back Mr. Sterling. Not sure about the decor.  Service and food is great.

Life's A Bagel is the best place for Bagels & Breads in Las Vegas!  They also have truly amazing pastries, cakes and cookies.  My husband and I eat at this place for lunch several times a week.  We also get catering from them for our office events.  Our clients love their food!

Their Deli sells slice-to-order meats; the sandwiches are excellent; the salads are also great!  They also serve homemade soups.

Today at lunch we had a salad and a sandwich.  We also had Boston Creme Pie and their wonderful Sugar-Free Cheesecake!!

Everything they make at Life's A Bagel is amazing, fresh and delicious.
You can tell that we LOVE this place.  Life's A Bagel is a GEM in Summerlin.

I've had them on my radar for some time now, but rarely find myself in this area. Fortunately, I was in the plaza and spotted Life's A Bagel from across the lot!

We got the Sliced Lox Platter ($13.99): Lox, red onion, tomato, capers, dill pickle, and your choice of bagel and cream cheese. I opted for a lightly-toasted Sesame Bagel and Scallion Cream Cheese. We really enjoyed this platter. The lox was delicious - great flavor and texure. The bagel was also great and perfectly chewy. This is probably one of the better bagel and lox I've had in town.

I also took a 1/2lb. container of Chicken Liver and it was all right. Nothing to write home about (I'd prefer it in the form of pâté), but it was enjoyable with French baguette, fresh onion, and fleur de sel.

I do wish they were closer since I don't buy several bagels at once and would prefer to stop by for the lox platter or a sandwich. Unsure about future trips considering the drive. However, I would love to try their other options, specifically sandwiches, and would definitely come back for the lox.
Best bagels in Vegas, hands down. Owners are amazing and really keep the quality of their product consistent.

Just tried this place for a nice breakfast on a leisurely Sat morning. I grew up on bagels. Life's a Bagel delivers. Great bagel selection, a full line deli, homemade soups, knish, pastries such as NY crumb cake & black n whites the size of your head, and locally roasted coffee! 

I enjoyed my onion bagel sandwhich with egg, cheese, and bacon. Piping hot to the last bite. I'm taking some NY crumb cake home because... Does crumb cake ever require a reason? 

Definitely check this lovely, locally-run place out!

I love me some good quality deli..its a rarity here in las vegas...but i was told this place was great and it is...i have now been going for 9 months to a year...they are owned by a very friendly couple matt and allison...a pleasure to deal with. all of their food is made fresh and is top quality i have yet to try anything here i dont like...so if you have a craving for solid deli fare..i highly reccommend this establishment. clean and friendly....mozeltov!

I love this bagel shop! Delicious food. My recommendation would be the San Francisco! The best sandwich with a side to choose and a pickle. Most def coming back and can't wait to try their new cream cheese.

What a nice find! Not just bagels! Incredible sandwich selection made fresh, deserts, breads, spreads, etc. Nicely surprised at the location too, in Smith's center w/everything you want and need nearby. Must visit.

Today I went to Life's A Bagel for the first time in more than 10 years. I'm so glad I returned. The bagels are great but today I tried the Sweet and Sour Cabbage Soup. I love cabbage soup but I'm always disappointed with the taste whenever I order it. Up until now, the best cabbage soup I ever had was my mother-in-law's, and she's long gone, and Nate 'n Al's in Beverly Hills. I just finished a bowl of the yummiest cabbage soup I've ever had, it was a 10!! Thank you Life's a Bagel, you'll be seeing a lot more of me from now on.

It was pure serendipity that I found this wonderful bagel/bakery/sandwich shop in Summerlin. I intended to visit my go-to sandwich shop, Nanny's, but they are on vacation this week. Life's A Bagel is in the kitty corner shopping center with the Smith's and I am so glad I stumbled upon them. They bake and sell all their own bread, not just the bagels, and the prices are super reasonable. Got a presliced challah bread (so soft and delicious) for five dollars! And the sandwich? Got the corned beef with swiss and coleslaw on marbled rye. My coworkers paused by my desk in awe to ogle the beauty of my sandwich, piled high with meat and toppings. And every bite lived up to the visual. There are also fresh baked deserts which I intend to try on my next visit as well as traditional kosher bagel fare, chopped chicken liver and lox. 10/10 will be back.

I love, love, love this place and the people who work there. The bagels are so fresh and yummy. Crispy and soft and chewy all at the same time. I brought my sister and brother in law from California that were visiting and they were in love. My sister wanted to buy all the bagels they had left. They are very generous with the cream cheese so if you like it a little less messy have them only put it on one side. I go here everytime I have a cheat day on my diet. There breads are fantastic and they will slice them for you with a really cool looking slicer. Eat at local businesses or youre missing out!

Food is delicious! Service speed is moderate but the staff is friendly. The lunch sandwiches are amazing! I love their mustard so I usually ask for extra. It's hard to limit myself to going only once a week
Bagels are barely better than Vons or Smiths. The sandwich I had was good, but I don't think I'd ever go back, too many other bagel joints with better bagels.

I've visited Life's A Bagel twice in the last month and had a great experience both times! The first time we ordered the nova lox platter on everything bagel and scallion cream cheese. The second time I ordered the same combination but as a sandwich. Anything with lox is usually a little pricey but they definitely give you a good amount of lox with your order. The bagels are delicious and have a great texture.

NOTE: If you get there late they may be out of certain bagels like onion and garlic
Super cute little spot. Excellent service and food. The lady at the counter even cut my bagel into quarters because she saw I had my hands full. :)

Here, I had the best bagel sandwich I have ever had, with just-cooked egg. This was my first time to the Summerlin area. My family and I were looking for a simple breakfast, and we got that and a juicy, tasty meal as well, and in a clean, cozy setting no less. Definitely plan on going regularly! Five stars!!

Favorite and best bagel place in Vegas!! My husband and I go here at least once a week--And being from New York we know our bagels! The food is always made fresh and they have a lot of options.. great for breakfast or lunch! They also have all kinds of delicious looking desserts that are made in house. Definitely need to try!

Items Selected:
Egg Bagel
French Toast Bagel
Cheddar Bagel
Black & White Cookie
Cinnamon Coffee Cake
NY Silverlake Cookies - Sprinkle Butter, Chocolate Florentine, White Chocolate Rainbow, Dark Chocolate Rainbow, Raspberry Pocket, Linzer Tart, Jelly Top, Snowball Melt Away, Chocolate Coconut Butter, Chocolate Nut Melt Away

Located on North Rampart Blvd under various names across the years, Life's a Bagel opened in early 2016 in the same plaza as German Bread's Bakery, the team formerly behind Sterling Bagel taking a calculated risk in opening so close to the Sun City Summerlin population, many of whom have already established their favorite New York City replacement in the form of The Bagel Café.

Not seeking to copy the success of their nearby competition, the space as well as the menu substantially smaller, Life's a Bagel instead focuses squarely on its eponymous bready rounds, more than a dozen varieties made each day with housemade Cream Cheese, Lox and various Deli Meats offered alongside a handful of cookies and cakes both imported and made on-site.

Not going so far as to boil their Bagels, a legitimate gripe for native New Yorkers looking for the authenticity found back home, Life's a Bagel nonetheless achieves the effect of a malted exterior and dense center with a thin skin by way of a recipe that shortens fermentation, the Egg version rich and far better than those found commercially while both the Cinnamon-Sugar shellacked French Toast and gooey Cheddar are more like something that would be found at Einstein Brothers than Panera, the crumb lightly stretchy and taking well to toasting, but just as good eaten as served.

Importing Italian Cookies from New York based Silverlake, a good choice albeit a little disappointing since The Bagel Café produces their collection in-house, a better choice comes in the form of toothsome Coffee Cake riddled and topped with Cinnamon Streusel, the Black & White Cookie perhaps the best in town with a cake-like case topped in slick frosting that makes no attempt at sugar restraint. 

***Not a Bagel expert by any means, but having tried some of the best, Life's a Bagel serves a good product despite not adhering to traditional methods, the Coffee Cake and Black & White showing that with a little more effort these folks could potentially raise their game.

On my visit this afternoon at the Citibank at Rampart & Lake Mead this afternoon during my Monday errands. I was craving bagels so I decided to Yelp and this place pop up. I've been coming to this shopping plaza for years but only notice this small shop in between the Smith's Food Center and Summerlin Omelet House. Upon entering you'll notice that the setup is simple and straightforward but with the exceptions of display cases; one with the variety of bagels, another with deli meats and one with various cream cheeses and salads. They had a descent selection of flavor bagels which were quite large in size. Tables and chairs that can accommodate 2 dozen ppl.

I decided on the Nova Lox Platter with an onion bagel. I was pleasantly surprise how delicious and fresh all the items on my platter were, from the smoked salmon to the onions and tomatoes. One of the best lox bagels I've had in awhile. And my rate was based mainly on this dish and the friendly staff that we're welcoming and helpful. There were a lot of deli style sandwiches and cookies that are offered but I was too full to try anything else. Definitely will come back and try more of their items.

This place definitely deserves 5 stars. I will go so far in saying this is the best bagel shop in Vegas. I believe the owners now are the owners that owned this shop originally. They had another owner sometime ago, but now it was re-bought? And returned to the OG's. 

Bagels here are soft, but not too soft, chewy, but not too chewy, and have a really good bite. I don't know the machinations of making a bagel are....really...like what yeast, or what they boil it in? But whatever is happening back there has made magical yields. 

Also, of course, I will mention pricing. This place is really reasonable for quality of food and product. Nova Lox Sandwich $8.49, with lox nothing short of amazing. They have $4 breakfast sandwiches. And...just an array of items at a good price. 

They have a really good selection of sandwiches, breads, and spreads. So far in the 20x I have come through, my favorites are the everything bagel, pumpernickel bagel, egg bagel, smoked salmon spread (bomb) and also they have an everything croissant (wuuttt). Croissant is so buttery good and soft, I am embarrassed to return so quickly after my family devoured them in less than 2 days. 

Just your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man, I mean bagel place, doing the job right!

If you live close and don't feel like driving to Bagel Cafe, this place can cure your fix.  The bagels are OK.  The meats are top notch, but their chopped liver and white fish salad are over mixed and "pureed", so there is no texture.

Prices are fair.
Got a turkey sandwich and it's great! Staff is very helpful didn't catch his name but service was great
Went in and bought a few bagels and found a long hair inside one of them. I'm so disgusted and never going back!

I'm visiting from out of town. I drive by this place yesterday and had to stop in to taste their bagels. Their staff is very friendly. Since I came around lunch time, I ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese and a scoop of their chicken salad. Both were delicious! The chicken salad doesn't have too much mayonnaise and is very tasty! The bagel was amazing! They only offer regular, plain cream cheese but they put the perfect amount on my bagel - not too much but just enough! The bagel was very flavorful and toasted just right as well. This place is awesome and a must-have for bagel lovers! They offer sandwiches and a variety of salads too.

I found this place on Uber Eats . Today was my second time ordering from this place and I was so impressed I felt they deserved a review. I can't get enough of the scallion cream cheese and the bagels are always fresh. I ordered a cob salad and the produce was fresh and even chopped per my request. The meats are great and the sandwiches are huge!! Great service . Definitely will recommend this place to others.

This has been my go-to bagel shop for the last two years living here in Summerlin. Unfortunately we are moving to Mountians Edge, I am certainly going to miss this place! I usually stop in once a week for a piled high bagel sandwich which comes with one side, or a big bowl of soup. The soups are great, but get there early for it because they tend to run out by 2pm which is when I would pop in. The bagel itself is always good because they are baked fresh daily. The vegetables on the sandwiches are always crisp and fresh and the meat and cheese is always delicious. The meats are deli fresh, not that store bought cheap stuff. The sides I've tried are chips (kinda hard to mess those up) and the macaroni salad. The macaroni salad is great! It has amazing flavor. Their little cookies and cakes that they bake from scratch are also lovely. Very reasonably priced for everything too. I'll certainly be stopping by while in the area in the future!!

Best bagels in town. The babka and cream cheese crumb cake are also terrific. My only real complaint here is that they put a little too much cream cheese when you have them prepare a bagel for you. Not a big deal though. It's the only authentic Water Bagels I can find in town. The coffee is pretty good too.

Fast and superb service from extremely nice people AND the food is plentiful and delicious!!! Bagels are better than Einstein's, and the sourdough bread makes me feel like I'm back in The City - HIGHLY recommend!

Bagels are ok, but the staff is rude as can be.  When you mess up an order causing an extra 50 miles to be driven, the appropriate response isn't "meh, it happens."  At least fake an apology.  What else will happen is me never stepping foot in there again
